trade-off between security and performance and performance includes things like startup times it includes
things like density when it comes to container hosting you could host multiple containers on a shared kernel
but there are challenges when it comes to security isolation and resource
isolation especially in hostile multi-tenant environments if you're running your own containers in a in a
tenancy boundary that you control then you know maybe a shared kernel will suffice but if you're running it in a
hostile multi-tenant environment as is the case with many of the services we run like like forget like lambda etc
that's that's not something that we can afford to do so as was mentioned earlier
we have historically earned on the side of running these workloads inside of
virtual machines and using the virtual machine tenancy boundary and isolation model to be able to host customer

an OS kernel so one of the however they provide the requisite security that you

still hypervisor partitions backed by VT x and and hardware support for
